title: Component Testing with Storybook and ButterCMS
description: Learn about how you can use Storybook along with ButterCMS to test your website visually before deploying changes.

title: How To Maintain A Large Next.js Application
description: Learn about some of the complex problems that faced while building and maintaining large Next.js applications.

title: Building a Multilingual Website with ButterCMS
description: Learn about how to use ButterCMS along with your Next.js application to serve content in multiple languages and turn those potential users into paying clients.

title: How to Build a Monorepo with Nx, Next.js and TypeScript
description: Learn what a monorepo is, and how monorepos help in developing applications faster with a better development experience.

title: Build a Twitter Clone Using TypeScript, Prisma and Next.js
description: Learn how to build a clone of Twitter using Next.js and Prisma.

title: How to integrate Next.js with Fauna using React Query
description: Learn about how we can integrate Next.js with Fauna.

title: User Authentication in Next.js with Strapi
description: In this tutorial, we'll be building a Next.js application and authenticate that with Strapi and NextAuth.

title: Difference between SWR and React Query in terms of fetching data
description: Learn about React Query and SWR which will help us create easy to understand and maintainable structure to fetch data from a back-end API endpoint.

title: Getting started with Mock Service Worker
description: Learn about Mock Service Worker and how we can use it to mock network requests.

title: Functional user interfaces with Moon.js
description: Learn about Moon.js by understanding what it is and why it was created.

title: JSX-driven components with Crank.js
description: Learn about Crank.js by building a blogging application, which will use the JSONPlaceholder API.

title: Optimizing static pages in your Next.js apps with Prisma
description: Learn about next-gen SSG support and why integrating your Next.js app with Prisma makes this feature even more powerful.

title: Building a table component with Tailwind CSS
description: Learn how easy it is to build components using Tailwind CSS. Learn how to create a table component and then use Tailwind to design a better variant of it.

title: Next.js, Storybook, and Lerna: Build a Monorepo Structure
description: Learn about how to build a monorepo using Lerna.

title: Building a Product Hunt clone app using Hasura and Next.js
description: This tutorial will demonstrate how to create a clone of product curation app Product Hunt using Hasura and Next.js.

title: Understand and implement your own Redux
description: Learn the basic concepts of Redux and learn about Actions, Reducers, and a Store in Redux.

title: Building a JAMstack Blog: Gatsby and ButterCMS on Netlify
description: Tutorial for building a lightning fast, static blog application hosted with Netlify using Gatsby on the front-end and ButterCMS to serve up the content.

title: Building reusable components using React
description: React is one of the most popular JavaScript libraries for building user interfaces. To build an application using React, you just need to build encapsulated components that can contain their own state.

title: How to test Next.js apps
description: Learn how to use Cypress to write End to End tests.

title: How to Build a CMS-powered Marketing Website while Avoiding WordPress
description: While WordPress powers 33% of the web, there are plenty of easier ways through which you can create your marketing site. WordPress can give you a basic outlook to your site.

title: How to write a simple React search plugin, publish it to npm, and deploy it to Github pages
description: Learn how to write a simple search plugin in React.

title: 9 steps for dockerizing a Rails api-only application
description: Docker is a program that helps us in containerizing the environment in which development in being done.

title: How to write highly readable React code — 10 coding style tips
description: This article will help you understand how you can write better code, so that other developers can better understand it. This article will give you a quick introduction to certain techniques I use while designing my components, and show you how you can do the same.

title: How to Authenticate your Elixir/Phoenix APIs using Guardian
description: Authentication is always a tricky subject. People tend to use so many types of authentication in their apps. Authentication using an email address and a password with an option confirm password field is the most common.

title: Bootstrapping an API-only backend for a Social Networking app using Elixir/Phoenix
description: While learning any programming language, I tend to document my struggles, about how I overcome stuffs and solve problems. Recently, I started learning Elixir mostly because I wanted to explore its ‘realtime' feature.
